results.title: Having twins
results.brief_description: Focuses on the experiences of several couples who have experienced the joys and problems associated with having twins. Includes comments by an obstetrician who explains the reasons why complications often attend the birth of twins, as well as footage showing an actual multiple birth.

results.title: The Mysteries of Hieronymus Bosch
results.creator_credit: Anne James and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The extraordinary paintings of Hieronymus Bosch, painted over 400 years ago, continue to haunt and disturb us to such an extent that there is constant argument about their meaning. Dr Nicholas Baum presents an unusual detective story as he tries to unravel the mysteries of the man about whom so little is known.

results.title: Rusting world = Declin
results.creator_credit: Laurent Coderre, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The scene is a desolate landscape which reveals no signs of life. Out of the stillness emerge two opposing factions, both wanting possession of a shiny object. This allegorical film suggests a decaying world created by greed, but the ultimate interpretation rests with the viewer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurent Coderre, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Black ice
results.creator_credit: Peter Shatalow, David Springbett, Don Hopkins and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Black Ice is a short film about a group of sailing enthusiasts who have adapted the principles of the sport to winter conditions. The sight of a fragile craft whisking across a frozen lake at one hundred kilometres per hour, leaving a shower of powdered ice in its wake, is breathtaking. Iceboat racing is exciting; a sport like no other in the world. Awards: Chicago, Budapest, Cortina d’Ampezzo.

results.title: Triangle Island
results.creator_credit: Ray Harper, Tom Radford, Anne Wheeler, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Forty miles northwest of Vancouver Island lies Triangle Island, an ecological reserve and home of close to one million birds. Bristol Foster, head of the British Columbia Ecological Reserves Program, guides us across the island through colonies of birds and sea lions. He stresses the need of preserving the ecological balance for the survival of future generations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Harper, Tom Radford, Anne Wheeler, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Physcial Education Activities for the Classroom (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A useful and informative film for classroom teachers who do not have daily access to the gymnasium or playing field. It illustrates how the classroom can be effectively used to conduct fitness activities, yoga exercises, modified games, folk and creative dance and many more exciting and challenging activities

results.title: Glimpses of China
results.brief_description: Gives glimpses of life in China and takes a more detailed look at four major cities- Xian, Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou (Canton). Each place shows a part of China as it is today- infinitely varied rapidly changing and a fascinating land of contrasts.

results.title: Potter: Robin Welch
results.brief_description: Robin Welch, a potter from Great Britain, was Artist-in-Residence at Gippsland Institute of Advanced Education. His work is thrown, but stretches wheel concepts to extremes with delicate, torn edges and painterly attitudes to glaze.

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 04
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The treasure-trove of Aboriginal rock-painting in Kakadu National Park reveals various styles of painting, from early ‘stick drawings’ to the later ‘x-ray’ style. Discusses the problems of protection and preservation of the paintings.
